sn41.2:2.2: The term of address “Honorable Senior” (bhante thera) is found only in this sutta and the next two. Note that when bhante therā is used above, the plural therā is nominative, whereas here the singular is vocative.
sn41.2:2.3: This question is also asked at SN 35.129:1.4.
sn41.2:2.4: The expression “senior venerable” (āyasmā thero), found in this sutta and the next, is rare, and in early Pali invariably associated with some failing of the senior monastics. In SN 21.10 a “Venerable Senior” is suggested to be senior in name only, while in SN 22.90 the advice of the senior venerables is ineffectual. Perhaps the piling up of excessive titles was felt to be a sign of pomposity.
sn41.2:3.1: Isidatta’s verse is at Thag 1.120. This is not the chamberlain Isidatta of Māgadha (SN 55.6:1.4).
